summary.p: [1] Bullinger should forward the enclosed letter from Bernardino Ochino to Augsburg. He is still staying with Oporinus, but does not yet know if he will remain in Basel.
[2] It would be nice if the things heard about the people of Zurich were false. May the Lord glorify His name and destroy the followers of Satan!
[3] What to expect from the people of Strasbourg, who are in negotiations with Emperor Charles V, remains unclear. However, many hope for better things from Constance.
[4] Greetings, also to the mutual friends.

div.p: Greetings. We both earnestly ask you, my dear Bullinger, to ensure that you forward this letter from our Bernardino Ochino to Augsburg. He is still staying with me, uncertain whether he will remain here in Basel or not.
We have heard things about you, which we would prefer to be false rather than true. May the Lord promote the glory of His name and destroy the followers of Satan with the spirit of His mouth!
What to hope for from Strasbourg, I do not know. However, we hear that many have better hopes for Constance. The Lord knows who are His; we earnestly ask you to pray diligently for us as well.
Farewell, most excellent and learned man, and greet our mutual friends when the opportunity arises. Basel, 26 February 1547. Johannes Oporinus, yours sincerely.
To the most esteemed friend, Heinrich Bullinger, in Zurich.
